alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 14 at 3:33AM MST until February 15 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Snow showers today will increase and become heavy this afternoon and tonight. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches below 6000 feet, with 6 to 12 inches above 6000 feet. Locally higher amounts up to 18 inches over the highest portions of the Mogollon Rim. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Areas near Dilkon, Forest Lakes, Heber-Overgaard, Holbrook, Kykotsmovi, Snowflake-Taylor and Winslow. * WHEN...From noon today to 6 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility with periods of near white-out conditions. Hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Snow forecast from noon Today to 6 AM Wednesday: Dilkon 3 to 5 inches Forest Lakes 16 to 22 inches Heber-Overgaard 7 to 11 inches Holbrook 1 to 3 inches Kykotsmovi 1 to 3 inches Snowflake-Taylr 3 to 5 inches Winslow 1 to 3 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
